short_description: This method is called before all other methods (except for __init__),
long_description:
and initializes parameters for this class.
-  interval: The string specifying the interval to run the algorithm. Choose from "15SEC", "1MIN", "5MIN", "15MIN", "30MIN", "1HR", "1DAY".
-  aggregations: A List of strings specifying the intervals to aggregate data. Choose from "1MIN", "5MIN", "15MIN", "30MIN", "1HR", "1DAY".
-  watchlist: A List of strings specifying the stock/crypto assets this algorithm tracks. Crypto assets must be prepended with a '@' symbol.
Any parameters set to None or an empty List will fall back to respective paramters set in the Trader class.

short_description: Method called right before algorithm begins.
Main method to run the algorithm.
Buys the specified asset.
long_description:
When called, a limit buy order is placed with a limit
price 5% higher than the current price. This is a general function that can
be used to buy stocks, crypto, and options. When buying cryptos, the symbol
must be prepended with a '@' symbol. When buying options, the symbol must be
formatted in OCC format, with any empty spaces removed.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of the asset to buy.

params.name: in_force
params.desc: Duration the order is in force. '{gtc}' or '{gtd}'.

params.name: extended
params.desc: Whether to trade in extended hours or not.

returns:
The following Python dictionary
- order_id: str, ID of order
- symbol: str, symbol of asset

raises.desc: There is an error in the order process.

short_description: Sells the specified asset.
long_description:
When called, a limit sell order is placed with a limit
price 5% lower than the current price. This is a general function that can
be used to sell stocks, crypto, and options. When buying cryptos, the symbol
must be prepended with a '@' symbol. When buying options, the symbol must be
formatted in OCC format, with any empty spaces removed.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of the asset to sell.

params.name: in_force
params.desc: Duration the order is in force. 'gtc' or 'gtd'.

params.name: extended
params.desc: Whether to trade in extended hours or not.

returns:
A dictionary with the following keys:
- order_id: str, ID of order
- symbol: str, symbol of asset

raises.desc: There is an error in the order process.

short_description: Retrieves data of specified option.
long_description:
Note that the price returned by this function returns the price per contract,
not the total price of the option.
returns:
A dictionary:
- price: price of option
- ask: ask price
- bid: bid price

short_description: Returns the option chain for the specified symbol and expiration date.
long_description:
The date parameter can either be a string in the format "YYYY-MM-DD" or a datetime object.
This function is often used in conjunction with the get_option_chain_info function in order to
retrieve the available expiration dates.
returns:
A dataframe with the follwing columns:
    - exp_date(datetime.datetime): The expiration date, as offset-naive DateTime object
    *with timezone adjusted to the timezone of the exchange being used*
    - strike(float): Strike price
    - type(str): 'call' or 'put'

The index is the OCC symbol of the option.

short_description: Returns data of a stock's option chain.
long_description:
Given a stock's symbol, this function returns a dictionary with two data.
The first is a list indicating the available expiration dates of the option.
The second is the multiplier, which indicates how many contracts are in a single option.
For example, if you buy an option priced at $1.20 and the multiplier is 100,
you will need to pay $120 to buy one option.

This function is often used in conjunction with the get_option_chain function.
returns:
A dict with the following keys:
- exp_dates: List of expiration dates
- multiplier: Multiplier of the option, usually 100

function: ema(self, symbol, period, interval, ref, prices)
short_description: Calculate EMA

params.name: prices
params.desc:
When specified, this function will use the values provided in the
list to perform calculations and ignore other parameters.

returns: A list in numpy format, containing EMA values

params.name: prices
params.desc:
When specified, this function will use the values provided in the
list to perform calculations and ignore other parameters.

returns: A list in numpy format, containing RSI values

When specified, this function will use the values provided in the
list to perform calculations and ignore other parameters.

function: bbands(self, symbol, period, interval, ref, dev, prices)
short_description: Calculate Bollinger Bands

params.name: prices
params.desc:
When specified, this function will use the values provided in the
list to perform calculations and ignore other parameters.

returns: A tuple of numpy lists, each a list of BBand top, average, and bottom values

short_description: Returns the current buying power of the user.
returns: The current buying power as a float.

short_description: Returns the current equity.
returns: The current equity as a float.

short_description: Returns the most recent candle as a pandas DataFrame
long_description: This function is not compatible with options.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of stock or crypto asset.

returns:
Price of asset as a dataframe with the following columns:
- open
    - high
    - low
    - close
    - volume

The index is a datetime object

raises.desc: If symbol is not in the watchlist.

short_description: Returns the candles of an asset as a pandas DataFrame
long_description: This function is not compatible with options.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of stock or crypto asset.

returns:
Prices of asset as a dataframe with the following columns:
- open
    - high
    - low
    - close
    - volume

The index is a datetime object

raises.desc: If symbol is not in the watchlist.

short_description: Returns the average cost of a specified asset.
returns: Average cost of asset. Returns None if asset is not being tracked.

raises.desc: If symbol is not currently owned.

short_description: Returns the current date.
returns: The current date as a datetime object

short_description: Returns the current date and time.
long_description: The returned datetime object is offset-naive, adjusted to the local timezone.
returns: The current date and time as a datetime object

short_description: Returns the current price of a specified asset.
returns: Price of asset.

raises.desc: If symbol is not in the watchlist.

short_description: Returns a list of recent prices for an asset.
long_description: This function is not compatible with options.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of stock or crypto asset.

returns: List of prices

short_description: Returns the quantity owned of a specified asset.

params.name: include_pending_buy
params.desc: Include pending buy orders in quantity.

params.name: include_pending_sell
params.desc: Include pending sell orders in quantity.

returns: Quantity of asset as float. 0 if quantity is not owned.

short_description: Returns the return of a specified asset.

params.name: symbol
params.desc: Symbol of stock, crypto, or option. Options should be in OCC format.

returns: Return of asset, expressed as a decimal.

short_description: Returns the current hour and minute.
long_description:
This returns the current time, which is different from the timestamp
of stock prices. For example, if you are running an algorithm every 5 minutes,
at 11:30am you will get price data with a timestamp of 11:25am. This function will return
11:30am.
returns: The current time as a datetime object

short_description: Returns the current stock positions.
returns: A list of Position objects for all currently owned stocks.

short_description: Returns the current crypto positions.
returns: A list of Position objects for all currently owned crypto.

short_description: Returns the current option positions.
returns: A list of OptionPosition objects for all currently owned options.

short_description: Returns the current watchlist.
